parameters.content:
## Need Review
These functions are not preserving the images properly.

## Chat Trigger
When a chat message triggers the workflow.
The URL from the message is extracted and send to check if its a URL or a google drive PDF link.

## PDF PARSER
If google drive PDF, PDF is Parsed using Docling.

parameters.text:
=You will receive JSON data with two fields:  
- {{ $json.contentText }}containing a passage of text.  
- {{ $json.itemTitle }} containing a title or label related to the content.  

Your task is to structure the output as follows:  
1. Assign the value of "contentText" to a field named "section".  
2. Assign the value of "itemTitle" to a field named "tag1".  
3. Generate **five additional relevant tags** that describe the content well and assign them to "tag2" through "tag6".  


### Example Input:
```json
{
  "contentText": "King Charles III inspects the Guard of Honour on September 12, 2022. Credit: Peter Byrne - WPA Pool/Getty Images",
  "itemTitle": "King Charles III"
}
{
  "section": "King Charles III inspects the Guard of Honour on September 12, 2022. Credit: Peter Byrne - WPA Pool/Getty Images",
  "tag1": "",
  "tag2": "",
  "tag3": "",
  "tag4": "",
  "tag5": "",
  "tag6": ""
}

parameters.jsonSchemaExample:
{
  "content": "King Charles III inspects the Guard of Honour on September 12, 2022. Credit: Peter Byrne - WPA Pool/Getty Images",
  "tags": [
    "King Charles III",
    "British Monarchy",
    "Royal Ceremony",
    "Changing of the Guard",
    "United Kingdom",
    "Historical Event"
  ],
  "category": "Royalty",
  "timestamp": "2025-03-05T12:00:00Z"
}

parameters.content:
## AI AGENT
**Prompt: Extracts structured data from text, assigning it to predefined fields and generating relevant tags.

Output Parser: Formats the extracted data into a structured JSON object for easy processing in workflows.

Creates Memory: Sends the structured JSON data to storage (e.g., database or vector memory) for retrieval and future use.**

## Search Memories
**üìå Search Memory by ID (GET)

Fetch a memory using its unique ID.
URL: http://amem-container:9000/memories/{memory_id}
üìå Search Memory by Query (POST)

Find memories based on a query.
URL: http://amem-container:9000/memories/search**
